moves.5... Qf6: After exchange black would bring his knight with tempo into the game.
moves.6. Nd2: symmetrical. I win a tempo after exchange.
moves.6... Bb4 7. c3 Qxf3 8. Nxf3 Bd6 9. e4: Without queens, the king can be a fighting piece, that's why I didnot play 0-0.
moves.10. e5 Ne4 11. exd6 Nxd6 12. Bf4: To make more alternatives, which black must now calculate.
moves.12... O-O: Black king is in safe, but after exchanges I want to bring in a pawn, that is why the king better stands in the middle.
moves.14. Kd2: Make contact between the rooks and centralize the king, too. The black knight has no good place, but must move.
moves.14... Nc6 15. a3: Maybe with b4 next, or just for preventing any attack with a and b pawns.
moves.15... e5 16. Bb5: I donot want to make better these pawns, so I try to exchange the lightfigures. If the knight goes away, the e5 pawn is over.
moves.16... exd4 17. Bxc6 dxc3+ 18. Kxc3: After Rc8 I would play Nd4 safely.
moves.18... bxc6 19. Rhe1: The only totally open file to catch.
moves.19... Rfe8 20. Rxe8+ Rxe8 21. Re1 Rxe1 2: Black cannot push the c-pawn, so I made moveless this crowd.
moves.23... Kf7 24. Nd3: I want to give my knight for the d5 pawn, to get the a-b-c files, where I can make an isolated pawn, what black must catch, so I get time for win the fight on the kingside and push a pawn in.
Kxd5 maybe better, but it doesnot matter anymore.
moves.28... Ke6 29. b5 axb5 30. axb5 g5 31. b6: black resigns, because have no pawnmoves and the d6 pawn hangs, so I can make the territory on the kingside mine.
